title: cafter
author: cafter
content: some days ago i discovered that my friend also invest in bitcoin and not have much knowledge about bitcoin, he just invested in it recently for doubling his money. Then i told him about what is bitcoin and how it's work, suggested some youtube channel to learn from but, he also did like many people do in greed of making fast and easy money and invest whatever coin is down(cheap) or trending. then i told him some lessons i learned in hard way like don't send your crypto to anyone it maybe scam, never invest listening to others, buy low sell high, never gamble with crypto and fiat also, etc. but after some days he came across a youtube video, video was live about tesla and elon musk giving away millions in bitcoin, the scam is like this: send 0.01 btc and get 0.02 btc back. I previously told him don't send crypto and there are many scams, but he didn't followed it and sent some amount of bitcoin and after some hours he realized that it was a scam! the question is how can we try to save newbie's from scams in crypto verse, we and many youtuber are saying that don't send bitcoins, there are many scams, etc. or we should not tell and left them to learn the lesson in hard way, I already listened many people those are in crypto for a while they said many things like don't be greedy, stay away from free crypto, etc. but i just listened and not applied and got scamed one time. what are the ways to learn lesson in easy ways and save newbie's from scams?BTW, i researched about their channel, they were live streaming about elon musk and cathie wood talking about some crypto related things which is very old video. then i checked their website where the people send crypto to double they are using one single address to get crypto, i checked their address in explorer and found out that they are making very good amount of money with this scam, like in millions. one more, sometime i came across trading signals telegram channel they are giving their paid membership for trading signals, then i searched their payment address in bitcoin explorer, and the amount was like $500-$600 million. i don't know that amount came from their telegram membership or some where else. but no one will share their personal address(i think that money was from users)

comments.author: Free Market Capitalist
comments.body: Quote from: cafter on May 03, 2023, 04:01:42 AMbut after some days he came across a youtube video, video was live about tesla and elon musk giving away millions in bitcoin, the scam is like this: send 0.01 btc and get 0.02 btc back. I previously told him don't send crypto and there are many scams, but he didn't followed it and sent some amount of bitcoin and after some hours he realized that it was a scam! There are a lot of scams like this. The first time I saw a video like this I didn't stop to think it was a scam and I could believe it was a real giveaway, in this case from Saylor. But it didn't occur to me to send money. Quote from: cafter on May 03, 2023, 04:01:42 AMthe question is how can we try to save newbie's from scams in crypto verse, You won't be able to save them all. There is always someone who is going to fall, due to ignorance, greed, absent-mindedness or things like that.There are things that help you not to fall, like understanding mathematics, understanding investments and profitability, remember that if something is too good to be true, it probably is and the like.I guees your friend learned the lesson the hard way. That is also a good way to be careful and avoid falling in scams in the future, although a tough one.

comments.author: DevilSlayer
comments.body: Why it should be always easy? The difficulty what gives value in every aspect. If your friend got scammed then it is not your fault, it is his fault why he lost his money. The accountability to ourself is what we need, a lot of people are blaming scammers why they lose money without knowing that it is their decision in the first place why they have been scammed. There are now a lot of scammers all around the internet and sad to see that there are many people fall for their trick. I do not know why even though the scam is very obvious people still investing their money knowing that it is scam. As for what I know, I think they are been controlled by their ego. The lack of knowledge for me it is also a factor why victims are keep falling in obvious tricks of the current scammers.Let's become a man that is accountable with ourselves and the people surround us. If I have and he is interested on making a lot of gains from investing and avoiding scam projects, my suggestion for him would be: he need to allocate a lot of time on studying before putting his money on the line. Actually it is also considered as investment in the world of psychic if you focus on getting information and knowledge about what you currently doing. Take note that there are no easy ways to learn, it is always hard and difficult so you must accept the fact that you really need courage and consistency in order to become a good investor. Stay hard guys!

comments.author: Fiatless
comments.body: Quote from: cafter on May 03, 2023, 04:01:42 AMsome days ago i discovered that my friend also invest in bitcoin and not have much knowledge about bitcoin, he just invested in it recently for doubling his money. His intention for investing in the sector was his greatest undoing. He saw the Bitcoin space as a money-doubling venture so when he saw the scam, he believed it was an opportunity to accomplish his objective. He also refused to learn about the sector because he was just interested in making money first before learning. At least he has learned his lesson the hard way.Quotethe question is how can we try to save newbie's from scams in crypto verse, we and many youtuber are saying that don't send bitcoins, there are many scams, etc. or we should not tell and left them to learn the lesson in hard way, I already listened many people those are in crypto for a while they said many things like don't be greedy, stay away from free crypto, etc. but i just listened and not applied and got scamed one time. Your responsibility is to keep teaching them about the Bitcoin space and exposing them to privacy and cybersecurity. The message is short and simple but very powerful "Don't be greedy". Any business in the industry that promises huge returns within a short period is a potential scam. Any crypto advertisement that gives you a clear prediction of how much you will earn at a certain period might be a scam because the crypto space is not predictable. Your responsibility is to inform them, it is up to them to accept your advice or reject it.

Some typical shitty scams in the house. Anyway, I've seen this multiple times already not only in Youtube, but in different social media platforms. So many times already that I can't even remember how many times I've seen this type of scams. Unfortunately, there are still some newbie, greedy, and ignorant investors who are falling into this kind of trap.Quote from: cafter on May 03, 2023, 04:01:42 AMthe question is how can we try to save newbie's from scams in crypto verse, we and many youtuber are saying that don't send bitcoins, there are many scams, etc. or we should not tell and left them to learn the lesson in hard way, I already listened many people those are in crypto for a while they said many things like don't be greedy, stay away from free crypto, etc. but i just listened and not applied and got scamed one time. Like @Poker Player said, you can't save them at all.For me, I believe that in investing, investors will only learn if they experienced getting scammed. I might be lucky that I'm one of the few people who didn't fall into these type of scams when I was a newbie, but for sure there are many newbies out there who are still falling into scams like this because of their greediness. They always see Bitcoin as a rich-quick scheme which is very wrong.If people experienced getting scammed, that's the time that they will realize what they did was wrong. They will make some adjustments, they will learn after that in order for them not to get scammed again. Learning really is very expensive, and that's what I believe. There's no way for newbies to save them when they're starting unless they have a mentor on their side constantly giving advice for them in which assets or which coins should they invest their money with.

comments.author: Hatchy
comments.body: Your friend obviously, is someone who would still fall victim again to something this stupid. From the look of things he decided to test his luck. Most YouTube channels broadcast old videos just to have fun and it would be very easy to do that and deceive people into believing that it's a live program. The rate at which social media is being used for scam these days is very high. And everyday, we hear stories of how people loss money not just crypto to scammers.  This whole thing is caused by greed. Why would you think that someone who you don't know, would want to double your money for you. He obviously wants to double his own and not yours.  I'm not saying that there aren't legit investment platforms out there, but at least try to do research. Ask your friends if you don't know how because this has helped me a lot. I would have fell victim several times but when ever I don't have and idea about something, I call a friend to help me out. Also, tell your friend to stay away from social media money making platforms as this would be best for him. And to teach him more about cryptocurrency so he knows that it's not about a get rich program because from look of things thats his own idea about crypto.

Scams are too old but will never be outdated and disappear because, in this society, there are always greedy people who want to make money quickly.Quote from: cafter on May 03, 2023, 04:01:42 AM the question is how can we try to save newbie's from scams in crypto verse, we and many youtuber are saying that don't send bitcoins, there are many scams, etc. or we should not tell and left them to learn the lesson in hard way, I already listened many people those are in crypto for a while they said many things like don't be greedy, stay away from free crypto, etc. but i just listened and not applied and got scamed one time. I used to be a newbie too, so I understand the psychology of newbies. They will not listen to anyone's advice and always think they are right until they are cheated and lose money. My approach sounds harsh, but I won't give any advice because I know they won't care. I want them to experience things for themselves, knowing that it will cost them dearly. That's how I myself grew up in this market. For me, valuable lessons do not come from free advice but must be bought with money, then they will appreciate it.

comments.author: worle1bm
comments.body: First of all he has done lot of mistakes with his bitcoin investment in the start also as you have mentioned:1) He invested without any knowledge which is against the rule of trading as if you are not having knowledge or information about what you are investing in you should not do so.He should not jump into this before making some quick research2) His greed for doubling his money as this is not make you rich scheme overnight and this is among common misconceptions arising out of your greed and ask you to invest money.You should look at charts and hold for long term if you want returns not double your money3) When there is such thing why your friend or any other victim don't care to find why Tesla or Elon would give you double what you give them? Is this some charity or donation going through or they have abundant funds to distribute to each user? 4) You should have directed him to some useful resources on the forum only instead of guiding him to those crap YouTube channels which are not giving any informative thing rather then some knowledgeable things about crypto so avoid them.These are lessons which will help him to stay safe in the future if he considered this loss as lesson.

comments.author: Crypt0Gore
comments.body: This is a very old trick that I've known since my first day in the crypto space, At that time Dogecoin was my favorite for claiming faucets and gambling too, the funny part is I was able to double my Dogecoin through something similar that OP is talking about, but those who tried after me all lose their coins. These scammers know how to get the best from people, they will intentionally double some people's coin, even BTC too, so that those who successfully get credited will now go and spread the news and bring in as many as possible. Greed is a bastard, only if you allow it, and sometimes, you just can't help it, your friend failed to take your advice seriously but now he have learned the hard way, he won't do the same ever again.

comments.author: kryptqnick
comments.body: Ah, the Tesla scam is such a classic. It was obviously a scam, and you, op, did a good job by trying to warn your friend about not sending cryptos to others. I'm sorry your friend lost that money and will now have to learn the hard way. I think that to learn the easy way, one should do some self-education first by exploring how Bitcoin works, how volatile it can be, which types of wallets exist, and learn about popular scam strategies. Preventive knowledge can help, but people should be willing to take time and learn. That being said, I was a bit careless in my early days with cryptos, so I've also learned the hard way, even though I thankfully invested a very small sum, so it wasn't a big problem.

comments.author: danherbias07
comments.body: First, you should also be careful at clicking links on those Youtube videos that you mentioned. You might end up a victim of phishing schemes which could take all the funds you have if ever it is saved in your computer or somewhere online. What can we do to make the newbies aware of such scams? Take them to this forum. I'll bet 100 percent they will learn a lot here since we discuss a lot of things including how to be aware of possible evil acts and how to preserve your Bitcoin in a safer way. If they don't like signing up here then they better not sign up with other websites that are prone to scams. Getting them informed is the only way to save them, about letting them experience the hard way, that will be a brutal way if they end up losing all the Bitcoin they worked hard to accumulate.

comments.author: demonica
comments.body: Well, you already told him things to be careful of, yet he didn't listen so maybe he didn't want to learn the easy way? He's already lucky to have someone who gave an advices about some dos and donts when it comes to Bitcoin but he still send bitcoin to a random YouTube live. It's pretty obvious in the first place that it's a scam since why would you have to send bitcoin first before it doubles? Some people really don't listen even if others already told them what to avoid doing so they have to deal with the consequences of their actions. I believe there are newbies to Bitcoin who really listen to advices of people who are familiar to it. But there are some who don't so they had to experience losing and getting scammed first before learning their lesson.

comments.author: Lida93
comments.body: Quote from: cafter on May 03, 2023, 04:01:42 AMthe question is how can we try to save newbie's from scams in crypto verse, we and many youtuber are saying that don't send bitcoins, there are many scams, etc. or we should not tell and left them to learn the lesson in hard way, I already listened many people those are in crypto for a while they said many things like don't be greedy, stay away from free crypto, etc. but i just listened and not applied and got scamed one time. One bitter-sweet way to save newbies from scams in the "crypto verse" is to let them learn from a first hand experience of being victim of a scam. Many may disagree on this ideology as been illogical but we all know that when you get a fire burn experience on maybe one of your toe or finger, when you see anything that looks like fire yiu will be the very first to escalate, avoid or distance yourself before anyone else would it.  And OP haven falling a victim of scam has a better understanding than anyone else around him, of the benefits of avoiding any social media, YouTube or online platforms with enticing crypto giveaways.  So at times it's a good thing learning through the hard way as it may save us from bigger victimization in the future.Quotewhat are the ways to learn lesson in easy ways and save newbie's from scams?The easier ways to learn:1. From other people's experience story.2. Always ask questions on things you lack understanding about, don't be too quick to engage (FOMO).3.Stay away from greed as crypto and greed don't go well together.

comments.author: jeraldskie11
comments.body: Quote from: cafter on May 03, 2023, 04:01:42 AMwhat are the ways to learn lesson in easy ways and save newbie's from scams?Actually, I checked their social media accounts to see if the project was likely a scam.1. "Community" is also one of my best important elements for determining whether this project is authentic. Even if a large community project could be a hoax, we can't dispute that the majority of them were legitimate.2. I also search for "consistent updates or announcement" to ensure that this project is not a fraud. 3. Projects that seemed too good to be true were most certainly a fraud.This is what I do when I want to know if a project is a scam or not.So, I believe that following this path would protect newcomers from scams.

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: Quote from: cafter on May 03, 2023, 04:01:42 AMthe question is how can we try to save newbie's from scams in crypto verse, what are the ways to learn lesson in easy ways and save newbie's from scams?The real situation here is that you can't be in many places at the same time, and we can't help everyone at the same time. Definitely, some will still fall victim, but at least they will learn. There is no possible way to totally change the fact that some people will still fall prey to scammers, but what we are doing still remains that threads like this will continue to come up, and also outside the forum, if you see some newbies to cryptocurrency or Bitcoiners that have a high enthusiasm to learn from you when you have the time to give them a few good educations about Bitcoin, just do teach them the right thing, and if they get benefits from the education you give them, they may also teach others, and by so doing, the rate at which newbies fall victim may gradually reduce.
